DOC.brief_title: Effects Palliative Care Quality Life Symptom Control Patients With Stage I , Stage II , Stage IIIA Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer That Can Be Removed Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To compare effect palliative care intervention ( PCI ) v standard care overall quality life psychological distress patient resectable stage I-IIIA non-small cell lung cancer . - To compare symptom control patient . - To compare geriatric assessment outcome , measure OARS ( Older Americans Resources Services ) Instrumental Activities Daily Living , MOS Activities Daily Living , MOS ( Medical Outcomes Study ) Social Activities Limitation Scale , Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale score , Karnofsky performance scale , patient . - To compare effect PCI v standard care resource use . - To identify subgroups patient benefit PCI relation sociodemographic characteristic , treatment factor , geriatric assessment predictor week 12 . OUTLINE : Patients assign 1 2 group . - Group I ( standard care ) : Patients receive standard care . Patients complete questionnaire baseline 6 , 12 , 24 , 36 , 52 week evaluate quality life ( QOL ) , symptom , psychological distress , geriatric assessment . A medical chart review perform 52 week assess progression treatment , episodes care , re-admissions . - Group II ( palliative care intervention ) : Patients receive individualized interdisciplinary palliative care intervention combine patient-centered teaching principle concepts learner-centered ( builds strength , interest , need learner ) , knowledge-centered ( teacher proficient content taught ) , assessment-centered ( learner give opportunity test understand receive feedback ) , community-centered ( opportunity available continue learn support ) . Patients undergo 4 teaching session ( base patient-centered teaching principle concept ) focus physical , psychological , social , spiritual well-being , respectively , week week 3-6 . Patients receive 4 follow-up phone call week 9-21 clarify question review concern teach session coordinate follow-up resource need . Patients also complete questionnaire group I .
